Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph

Interface Node

All Superinterfaces:
Connected<Node>, Element, Identity, Specialized, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable
All Known Subinterfaces:
TreeNode
All Known Implementing Classes:
ALDataNode, ALNode, ALReadOnlyDataNode, SimpleDataTreeNode, SimpleReadOnlyDataTreeNode, SimpleTreeNode, TreeGraphDataNode, TreeGraphNode, TreeGraphReadOnlyDataNode
public interface Node extends Element, Connected<Node>

Ancestor to all node classes.

Nodes do not need edges to exist: a graph may contain unconnected nodes.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 10 mai 2019

    Default is to return the java class name.

    connectLike​(Node element)
    Connects this connected element (node or edge) exactly like the argument, i.e by losing its former connections before copying those of the argument.

    • connectTo

      Edge connectTo​(Direction direction, Node node)
      Connects this node to the node argument and return the resulting edge (will instantiate an edge), according to specified direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction in which to connect
      node - the node to connect to
      Returns:
      the edge

    • connectTo

      default Edge connectTo​(Direction direction, Node node, ReadOnlyPropertyList edgeProperties)
      Connects this node to the node argument and return the resulting edge (will instantiate an edge), according to specified direction, adding the property list to the edge (if compatible with the EdgeFactory used to instantiate the edge). The default implementation of this method ignores the edgeProperty argument.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction in which to connect
      node - the node to connect to
      edgeProperties - the property list to attach to the edge
      Returns:
      the edge

    • connectTo

      default void connectTo​(Collection<? extends Node> nodes)
      connects this node to a list of other nodes, with this node = start of the resulting edges.
      Parameters:
      nodes - the list of nodes to connect to.

    • connectTo

      void connectTo​(Direction direction, Collection<? extends Node> nodes)
      Connects this node to a list of other nodes.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction in which to connect to the nodes
      nodes - the list of nodes to connect to.

    • connectLike

      default void connectLike​(Node element)
      Description copied from interface: Connected
      Connects this connected element (node or edge) exactly like the argument, i.e by losing its former connections before copying those of the argument.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • replace

      default void replace​(Node element)
      Description copied from interface: Connected
      Replaces another connected element of the same type (node or edge) by this instance. This instance adds the argument connections to its former connections, and the argument is disconnected from the graph.
      Specified by:
      replace in interface Connected<Node>
      Parameters:
      element - the connected element (node or edge) to replace

    • traversal

      default Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(int distance)
      Description copied from interface: Connected
      As traversal(), but stopping after distance recursion steps. For example, node.traversal(1) will return only node, while node.traversal(2) will return all the nodes connected with only 1 edge to this one.
      Specified by:
      traversal in interface Connected<Node>
      Parameters:
      distance - the number of recursion steps to search
      Returns:
      the connected component (=sub-graph) containing this instance

    • traversal

      default Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(int distance, Direction direction)
      Description copied from interface: Connected
      As traversal(), but following only one direction from the starting connected element (node or edge) and stopping after distance recursion steps.
      Specified by:
      traversal in interface Connected<Node>
      Parameters:
      distance - the number of recursion steps to search
      direction - the direction in which to search
      Returns:
      the connected component (=sub-graph) containing this instance

    • classId

      default String classId()
      Description copied from interface: Specialized
      Default is to return the java class name. Descendants should override this default
      Specified by:
      classId in interface Specialized
      Returns:
      The simple class name string.
